thread.title: The Indianapolis Colts' trick play has a video game tribute
thread.title_full: The Indianapolis Colts' trick play has a video game tribute

title: The Indianapolis Colts' trick play has a video game tribute
text:
The Indianapolis Colts' trick play has a video game tribute By Andy Larsen | Posted Oct 20th, 2015 @ 11:15am 1  
SALT LAKE CITY  Welcome to From Left Field! Here are more of some of the most fun and interesting things that happened in sports this past weekend. The Indianapolis Colts' trick play now has a video game tribute 
If you weren't watching live on Sunday night on NBC, you've probably seen it by now anyway: the Colts' "creative" fake punt play that ended up in misery. Here's the link to it , if you've missed out. 
It's gotten so popular that Sports Illustrated's "The Cauldron" created a Tecmo Bowl tribute, and if you played that growing up like I did, well, it's a must watch: 
Go virtual Chuck Pagano! This kid broke a window with his hockey shot 
Speaking of things I did growing up, driveway hockey was definitely one of them. We had makeshift goals and alternated between using a puck and a ball, because we could never decide which was better suited for concrete. 
But my parents had one rule: Leave the garage door up when playing hockey. Who knows what could happen otherwise? 
Well, this is what they had in mind. The kid's reaction is adorable, though: John Wall skips preseason game for something more important 
John Wall, star point guard for the Washington Wizards, is a good man. Wall missed the Wizards' preseason game Saturday night in order to attend the "Light the Night Walk," a fundraiser for blood cancer research. 
He did this in memorial of Miyah, a 5-year-old girl he befriended last year. She died last December, leaving Wall to give this emotional postgame interview that's pretty incredible: 
Wall, despite what radio host Colin Cowherd will tell you, is an incredible human. Credit to him, and the Wizards, for putting lives over basketball. Andy Larsen
